solution_line_template: If Grace has {grace_pastries} pastries, then both Phoebe and Calvin each have {grace_pastries}-{calvin_phoebe_less_than_grace} = <<{grace_pastries}-{calvin_phoebe_less_than_grace}={calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}>>{calvin_phoebe_pastries_each} pastries.

The total number of pastries that Phoebe and Calvin have is {calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}+{calvin_phoebe_pastries_each} = <<{calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}+{calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}={phoebe_calvin_total}>>{phoebe_calvin_total}
Together, Phoebe, Calvin, and Grace have {phoebe_calvin_total}+{grace_pastries} = <<{phoebe_calvin_total}+{grace_pastries}={phoebe_calvin_grace_total}>>{phoebe_calvin_grace_total} pastries.

Since Calvin and Phoebe each have {calvin_phoebe_more_than_frank} more pastries than Frank, then Frank has {calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}-{calvin_phoebe_more_than_frank} = <<{calvin_phoebe_pastries_each}-{calvin_phoebe_more_than_frank}={frank_pastries}>>{frank_pastries} pastries.
